oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate Veteran's Fiddler's Contest at the Opera House
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Announcement of fund-raising fiddling and banjo picking contest to raise money for the Leonidas Polk Bivouac No. 3, and William Henry Trousdale Camp No. 495 of Confederate Veterans and for "indigent and decrepit Confederate Soldiers." There is notation of a parade to be led by the Columbia Band, the program listings, and the prizes available. A color image of a Confederate flag has been placed at the top of the broadside.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Announcements; Handbills; Fliers (printed matter); Flags; Military standards
Broadsides; Fiddlers; Banjoists; Bands (Music); Parades; Contests
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Maury Democrat Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside indicates the financial need becoming evident among Tennessee's aging and ailing generation of Confederate veterans. Legislation establishing the Tennessee Board of Pension Examiners was enacted in 1891 to handle the administration of pensions for the state's indigent, disabled, and honorably discharged Confederate veterans. Confederate widows' pensions were first issued in Tennessee in 1905.
